intro: Isotrema pseudocaulialatum, commonly known as the false stemless thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Isotrema pseudocaulialatum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
